byline.contributor: Emily Feng in Beijing and Choe Sang-Hun in Seoul contributed reporting.

abstract: Growing popularity of South Korean video messaging app Snow, copycat of Snapchat, illustrates how popular American smartphone apps face headwinds in fast-growing Asian countries; Snow, with 30 million downloads, is vying for millions of potential clients in China and elsewhere across Asia.
lead_paragraph: The quick growth of Snow, an almost one-to-one clone of that other photo app, shows that success abroad is no guarantee for American tech stars.

headline.main: A South Korean Copy of Snapchat Takes Off in Asia
headline.print_headline: Copycat App Takes Aim at Snapchat in East Asia

snippet: The quick growth of Snow, an almost one-to-one clone of that other photo app, shows that success abroad is no guarantee for American tech stars....
